decks.notes: The main concept of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy by utilizing a mix of legendary creatures and artifacts. The key strategy is to generate mana quickly with Mox Amber and other mana sources, while utilizing powerful legendary creatures like Rona, Herald of Invasion and Cecil, Dark Knight to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes support cards like Relic of Legends and Plaza of Heroes to enhance the abilities of the legendary creatures and maintain board presence. This deck aims to establish early dominance and close out the game swiftly.

This deck focuses on aggressive play and utilizing Arclight Phoenix to quickly overwhelm opponents. The main strategy involves casting cheap spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard. The deck also includes card draw and filtering to maintain a high tempo and consistently bring back Arclight Phoenix. The inclusion of Cori-Steel Cutter and Picklock Prankster provides additional threats and disruption, while Artist's Talent and Into the Flood Maw offer additional removal and control options. The goal is to outpace opponents and deal damage quickly to secure victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressively attacking your opponent with creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck has a mix of aggressive creatures, disruption, and removal to create a fast and powerful game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with a mix of counterspells, card draw, and removal spells. It aims to disrupt the opponent's plans and slow down their game while setting up for powerful late-game plays with cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and March of Otherworldly Light. The deck also includes a variety of lands that can help fix mana and provide additional utility. The overall strategy is to outlast the opponent and grind out a win through attrition and card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures like Cloud, Midgar Mercenary and Kemba, Kha Enduring, then equipping them with powerful equipment like Colossus Hammer and Shadowspear to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Sigarda's Aid and Nahiri, the Unforgiving to ensure that the equipment can be attached at instant speed for maximum surprise value. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive board presence while disrupting their strategy with cards like Chainsaw and Sheltered by Ghosts.

The main strategy of this Gruul Aggro deck is to rapidly deploy aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on efficiently using cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage to apply pressure early in the game. Cards like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage provide additional reach and removal to clear the way for your creatures. The deck also includes some land cards that can provide additional value or utility as the game progresses. Overall, the deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with fast, aggressive threats.

The deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo, utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Parhelion II to overwhelm opponents. It also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's game plan. Bloodtithe Harvester and Overlord of the Balemurk provide additional value and power to the deck, while removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse help maintain board control. The deck's mana base includes a mix of fast lands, shock lands, and pathways to ensure consistent and smooth gameplay. Ultimately, the goal is to establish a dominant board presence and win through the combo.

The main idea of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful synergies. By utilizing cards like Bishop of Wings, Resplendent Angel, and Righteous Valkyrie to create a strong board presence, along with support from Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic for ramp, this deck aims to quickly build a dominant position on the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition provide valuable utility and disruption to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements, such as counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption, to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents. The deck also includes a variety of card draw and card selection tools to ensure consistency in drawing relevant cards. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck while also providing flexibility in terms of mana sources.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Godless Shrine and Monument to Endurance to facilitate the combo, while also including removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughseize to control the board. Seasoned Hallowblade and Fleeting Spirit provide additional threats and protection, while cards like Takenuma, Abandoned Mire and Shadowy Backstreet offer utility and flexibility. The goal is to quickly establish the combo and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to apply pressure early with efficient threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. Unholy Annex and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker help to generate additional value and close out games quickly. With a strong mana base and versatile removal options like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, this deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo throughout the game.

This red deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by using aggressive creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, supported by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The deck also includes cards like Manifold Mouse and Monstrous Rage to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Mutavault and Bonecrusher Giant provide versatility and extra damage potential. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats while finishing them off with direct damage spells.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck includes card draw spells like Opt and Consider to fuel Treasure Cruise, allowing for consistent access to resources. Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse provide removal options while Picklock Prankster can disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes some utility lands like Otawara, Soaring City and Hall of Storm Giants to provide additional benefits. Overall, the strategy is to be fast, efficient, and relentless in pressuring the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells and then bringing back Arclight Phoenix for repeated attacks. The deck includes a mix of cheap spells and card draw to enable the Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard and put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Temporal Trespass adds an extra burst of tempo, while cards like Lightning Axe provide removal options. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, overwhelming opponents with a combination of direct damage and evasive threats.

This UW Control deck focuses on using cards like Consult the Star Charts, Narset, Parter of Veils, and No More Lies to control the opponent's resources and search for answers. The deck also includes cards like Field of Ruin and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats on the board, while using Temporary Lockdown and Get Lost to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a companion like Kaheera, the Orphanguard providing additional value, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and strategic plays.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful board presence. It focuses on using cards like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade to protect the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces with lands like Geier Reach Sanitarium and The Mycosynth Gardens, while providing the necessary color fixing with cards like Brightclimb Pathway and Concealed Courtyard. Overall, the deck aims to quickly set up its combo and overwhelm the opponent.
